revised_title: Awards and Achievements in Science: Royal Society Honorees
tldr: The article highlights the accomplishments of various scientists who were awarded medals by the Royal Society in 1980. The honorees include Sir Derek Barton for his contributions to organic chemistry, Professor W. F. Vinen for his work on liquid helium, Sir Denys Wilkinson for his research in nuclear physics, Professor Henry Harris for his studies on cell fusion and genetic control, Dr. J. P. Wild for his development of the InterScan aircraft instrument landing system, Professor A. W. Johnson for his chemistry of natural products, Professor S. Wright for his work in population genetics, and Dr. F. J. M. Farley for his electrodynamics research.
